conclusion: Analyze the v-t graph to determine if the particle undergoes linear motion with gradually decreasing acceleration from 1 to 2 seconds.
The v-t graph shows velocity on the y-axis and time on the x-axis. At 1 second, the velocity is 20 m/s. At 2 seconds, the velocity is 10 m/s.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time and can be calculated as the slope of the velocity-time graph.
The graph shows a curve between 1 and 2 seconds.
To find the acceleration at different points in this interval, evaluate the slopes of tangent lines at various points in this segment.
The illustration shows tangents at different points between 1 and 2 seconds. At 1 second, the tangent has a steep slope. As time progresses, the slope of the tangent lines decreases.
The slope of the tangents represents the instantaneous acceleration. Since the slope of the tangents gradually decreases as time progresses from 1 to 2 seconds, the acceleration is decreasing.
Yes, it is correct to say that the particle undergoes linear motion with gradually decreasing acceleration from 1 to 2 seconds.
